pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3: He had a beautiful dwelling with a room in the middle and corridors on all sides.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.4: The bed and bench were nicely made up,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.5: and the water for drinking and the water for washing had been well placed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7: Many people came to see Udāyī’s dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8: Among them was a certain brahmin and his wife. They approached Udāyī and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.9: “Venerable, we would like to have look at your dwelling.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11: Udāyī took the key, unlocked the upper bolt, opened the door, and entered the dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14: Opening some windows and closing others, Udāyī walked around the inner room and came up from behind the brahmin lady, touching her all over.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15: Then the brahmin thanked Udāyī and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.16: The brahmin then expressed his delight,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17: “These Sakyan ascetics who live in the wilderness are superb.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.23: “These Sakyan ascetics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1: The monks heard the criticism of that brahmin.
